Package io.crums.sldg.entry

Class TokenizedEntry

java.lang.Object
io.crums.sldg.entry.Entry
io.crums.sldg.entry.TextEntry
io.crums.sldg.entry.TokenizedEntry
public class TokenizedEntry
extends TextEntry
Word tokenized hashing. Design to support word-by-word redactions in a single entry.
See Also:
hash()

    • hash

      public java.nio.ByteBuffer hash()
      Returns the 32-byte hash of the contents. This is a straight digest of the contents. A subclass may override in order to exploit a more structured strategy for computing this hash.

      Word-redactable Hashing Scheme

      First, a list of SHA-256 hashes is assembled from the individual words in the text. If the list is empty the noWordsHash() is returned; if the list is a singleton, then the hash of that single word is returned; otherwise, the hash of the concatentation of the individual word hashes is returned.

      TODO: (already on a tangent)

      Overrides:
      hash in class Entry
      Returns:
      a read-only, 32-byte wide buffer

    • wordHashes

      public java.util.List<java.nio.ByteBuffer> wordHashes()

      Returns:

    • newTokenizer

      protected java.util.StringTokenizer newTokenizer​(java.lang.String text)
      Returns the word tokenizer. The default uses whitespace as a delimiter. I.e. whitespace doesn't count.
      Parameters:
      text -
      Returns:
